content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Implement AS MANY new ideas as you can as PopeBot skills in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). For EACH skill: create the SKILL.md, write the implementation code, and write and run a test to prove it works. Do not stop at one skill â€” keep going until you run out of good ideas or time. After you have built and tested everything, use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a comprehensive progress report listing every skill you built, your test results for each, and code samples.

content.thinking:
This is an exciting exploration and implementation task! I need to:

1. Scan three GitHub repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures:
   - https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw
   - https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw
   - https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot

2. Implement as many new ideas as possible as PopeBot skills in the sandbox (.pi/skills/)

3. For each skill:
   - Create SKILL.md with frontmatter
   - Write the implementation code
   - Write and run a test to prove it works

4. Send a comprehensive email report to winsorllc@yahoo.com

Let me start by exploring these repositories to understand what tools, skills, and architectures they contain. I'll use git to clone them temporarily or fetch information about them.

Let me first check what's already in the .pi/skills/ directory and understand the current structure.
